description: a(n) is the smallest positive integer m such that the number of partitions p(m)=A000041(m) is divisible by n.
comments: The initial term could also be taken to be 0.From the formula a(p(n)) = n, it follows that every positive integer appears in this sequence. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Feb 09 2016
links: M. F. Hasler, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,20000.
M. F. Hasler, A046641.c - C program for fast computation of a(n) for large values of n. [From _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2008]
example: The first partition number divisible by 9 is p(14) = 135, so a(9) = 14.
mathematica: Table[SelectFirst[Range[10^3], Divisible[PartitionsP@ #, n] &], {n, 70}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 10 2016, Version 10 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n) = my(m = 1); while(numbpart(m) % n, m++); m; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 10 2016
crossrefs: See A091690 for simple PARI code, A145523(n)=a(2^n), A145524(n)=a(10^n), A145771 for record values. [_M. F. Hasler_, Oct 18 2008]
author: _David W. Wilson_
